title.narrative: 2.2 INSTITUTIONAL CAPACITY BUILDING

description.narrative: By 2017, institutional duty bearers have strengthened capacity to deliver sustainable safe drinking water, improved sanitation services and hygiene practices with a focus on the most disadvantaged children, which contributes to Sanitation, Wash â€“ General. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2017, most vulnerable and marginalized children and women are using safe drinking water, improved sanitation coverage and hygiene practices.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2017, institutional duty bearers have strengthened capacity to deliver sustainable safe drinking water, improved sanitationservices and hygiene practices with a focus on the most disadvantaged children

description.narrative: UNICEF continued to strengthen the capacity of provincial governments including district WASH Committees, (government and NGOs) to end open defecation and gain access to safe water. UNICEF&39;s support to government resulted in 661,657 people (including men, women and children) gaining access to safe drinking water | Status:Constrained | As-of Date:31/12/2017
